p: Recently, Silva et al. (2020) studied various extracts of fruits of Poincianella ( Caesalpinia) microphylla, a plant found in Brazilian Caatinga. The crude aqueous extract was successively extracted with different ratios of the water-methanol mixture. The main compounds identified were hydrolyzable tannins like gallotanins and ellagitannis. Procyanidin dimer, epicatechin, ellagic acid, and O-(digalloyl) quinic acid were also identified. Tannins enriched fractions presented anti-trichomonas activity.
